es.uc3m.baldo.opinais.core.algorithms

Class CoEvolutionaryAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.uc3m.baldo.opinais.core.algorithms.AbstractAlgorithm
      • es.uc3m.baldo.opinais.core.algorithms.EvolutionaryAlgorithm
        • es.uc3m.baldo.opinais.core.algorithms.CoEvolutionaryAlgorithm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Algorithm

    public class CoEvolutionaryAlgorithm
extends EvolutionaryAlgorithm
    CoEvolutionaryAlgorithm.

    Implements an evolutionary algorithm.

    The evolutionary algorithm evolves a population of detectors, based on their fitness, which is calculated as the number of recognized individuals minus the number of false positives.

    A roulette selector method is used to select individuals. Uniform crossover and bit mutation is implemented to reproduce and mutate detectors.

    The co-evolutionary algorithm includes a second phase of fitness calculation, where the fitness of all the detectors for a type with the best detectors of the remaining types is evaluated.

    This way, the algorithm benefits from the cooperation of detectors from different types.

    Author:
    Alejandro Baldominos

    • Field Detail

      • penalizeUnclassified

        protected boolean penalizeUnclassified

        Whether the cooperative fitness function must penalize the case where the individual remains unclassified, or just ignore it.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CoEvolutionaryAlgorithm

        public CoEvolutionaryAlgorithm(int speciesSize,
                       double typeBias,
                       double generalityBias,
                       double crossoverRate,
                       double mutationRate,
                       double elitism,
                       boolean penalizeUnclassified,
                       int maxGenerations)

        Builds a new co-evolutionary algorithm.

        Parameters:
        speciesSize - the size of the detectors population.
        typeBias - the probability that a randomly created detector detects self individuals.
        generalityBias - the probability that a bit in a randomly created detector is a wildcard.
        crossoverRate - the probability that crossover is performed over two parent detectors to obtain a child.
        mutationRate - the probability that mutation is performed in a bit in the detector schema.
        elitism - percentage of the best individuals to be maintained across generations.
        penalizeUnclassified - whether the cooperative fitness function must penalize the case where the individual remains unclassified
        maxGenerations - the maximum number of generations of the algorithm.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public Classifier run()

        Runs the evolutionary algorithm.

        The evolutionary algorithm evolves a population of detectors, based on their fitness, which is calculated as the number of recognized individuals minus the number of false positives.

        A roulette selector method is used to select individuals. Uniform crossover and bit mutation is implemented to reproduce and mutate detectors.

        The co-evolutionary algorithm includes a second phase of fitness calculation, where the fitness of all the detectors for a type with the best detectors of the remaining types is evaluated.

        This way, the algorithm benefits from the cooperation of detectors from different types.

        Specified by:
        run in interface Algorithm
        Overrides:
        run in class EvolutionaryAlgorithm
        Returns:
        a classifier which maps a type to the best detector found by the algorithm for that type.

      • fitness

        private double fitness(java.util.Map<Type,Detector> detectors)

        Calculates the cooperative fitness.

        This fitness is calculated for a detector of a given type, when it is asked to cooperate with the best detectors of the remaining types to guess the type of an individual.

        Parameters:
        detectors - the detector whose fitness is to be evaluated and the best detectors of the remaining types.
        Returns:
        the value for the cooperative fitness.
